channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An Interest Rate Cut
item.description: We explore the politics of today’s Fed announcement.

item.title: Child, 10, Stabbed Near Japanese School in China
item.description: The child was wounded and a 44-year-old man was in custody, the police said. Other Japanese schools in China warned parents and students to be cautiou...

item.title: Man behind the term ‘presenteeism’ says bosses ordering workers back to the office are ‘the dinosaurs of our age’
item.description: A work psychology guru says Amazon's RTO mandate goes against the evidence and won't improve productivity.

item.title: Pager Attacks in Lebanon Puncture Hezbollah’s Image as Powerful Anti-Israel Force
item.description: The coordinated attacks targeting the group’s wireless devices caused thousands of injuries, piercing the group’s rank and file and raising questions ...

item.description: The coordinated attacks targeting the group’s wireless devices caused thousands of injuries, piercing the group’s rank and file and raising questions ...

item.title: Introducing the first Fortune LGBTQ+ Leaders list
item.description: Today we celebrate the leaders who have bravely blazed a trail, leaving the path clear for the next generation.

item.title: Hezbollah Blames Israel for Deadly Pager Attack, and Fed Expected to Cut Rates
item.description: Plus, gymnast Jordan Chiles’s Olympic medal fight.

item.title: Israel’s Pager Attack Has No Clear Strategic Goal, Analysts Say
item.description: By targeting so many pagers at the same time, Israel demonstrated technical prowess. But its long-term intent is unclear.

item.title: 45,000 longshoremen at key U.S. ports threaten to strike over automation and wages
item.description: The move would shut down ports that handle about half the nation's cargo from ships.

item.title: Israel’s Pager Attack Has No Clear Strategic Goal, Analysts Say
item.description: By targeting so many pagers at the same time, Israel demonstrated technical prowess. But its long-term intent is unclear.

item.title: Russia Seizes Eastern Town as Ukraine Says It Hit a Big Ammunition Depot
item.description: The capture of Ukrainsk underscored Russia’s steady advances in the Donetsk region. Ukraine is trying to counter with strikes on Russian military infr...

item.title: Michael Kors admits defeat by influencers and celebrities, claiming ‘brand fatigue’ in $8.5 billion federal antitrust trial
item.description: The FTC is attempting to block Tapestry’s acquisition of Capri, which would create a bag behemoth.

item.title: Russia Seizes Eastern Town as Ukraine Says It Hit a Big Ammunition Depot
item.description: The capture of Ukrainsk underscored Russia’s steady advances in the Donetsk region. Ukraine is trying to counter with strikes on Russian military infr...

item.title: Kashmiris Are Voting Again. But Do They Have a Voice?
item.description: An election that began on Wednesday will restore some of the self-rule India took away in 2019. But a lasting chill has fallen over Kashmir.

item.title: Randstad CEO: Coming out at work was crucial for my career—but I was lucky
item.description: 'Coming out at work was a pivotal moment in my career,' writes Randstad CEO Sander van ‘t Noordende.
